        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>lesson plan</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>teacher</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">10-12</string>
            <string language="en">10-12</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">1. Presentation of a cylinder (learning resources – a film)

A detailed characterisation of a cylinder using the learning resource – a film.

2. A description of the solid of revolution (learning resource – a picture)

	Slant height of a cylinder – description on the basis of an animation (learning resource – an animation)
	Giving a definition of a right circular cylinder.
	Students draw a cylinder in their notebooks and write down a description of it.

3. Area of a cylinder (learning resource – a picture)
	Description of the process of calculating the lateral area and base area of a cylinder (learning resource – a picture). Students copy the picture and description to their notebooks.
	Giving the surface area formula of a cylinder – (learning resource).
      Students copy it to their notebook. 
	Discussing a few examples of calculating the surface area of a cylinder – (learning resource – an example).

4. Volume of a cylinder (learning resource – a picture)
	Description of the process of calculating volume area of a cylinder (learning resource – a picture).
	Giving the volume formula – (learning resource – a formula). 
Students copy it to their notebooks.
	Discussing a few examples of calculating volume of a cylinder – (learning resource – an example).

5. Work in groups:
A teacher divides students into four groups. Each of the teams is given a handout with an exercise. Students must to calculate the surface area and volume of a given cylinder. When the students finish their task, children present their results. A teacher checks if the answers are correct and gives them the appropriate marks.

Materials:
	handout of an exercise (one copy for each of four groups)
Equipment:
	multimedia projector
	laptop
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
